intro: Banisteria argentea var. obtusiuscula, commonly known as silver banisteria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking silver-green foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape, with a waxy texture that contributes to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a decorative plant in tropical gardens.
